        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>LifecycleStrategyRegistry</h1>
                <p>Registry for available instance lifecycle strategies.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/LifecycleStrategyRegistry.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>LifecycleStrategyRegistry holds the map of available lifecycle names to their strategy
                        implementations.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>The container supports pluggable lifecycles. By default, it supports:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>singleton:</strong> One instance per container.</li>
                            <li><strong>scoped:</strong> One instance per scope (e.g., request).</li>
                            <li><strong>transient:</strong> New instance every time.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>You can use this registry to add custom lifecycles, such as "session" or "job", without
                            modifying the core kernel.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Story Example</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Registering a custom strategy.</p>
                    <div class="example">$registry = new LifecycleStrategyRegistry();

                        // Add a custom 'thread' local strategy
                        $registry->register('thread', new ThreadLocalStrategy());

                        // Now services can use 'thread' as their lifetime
                        $container->bind(MyService::class)
                        ->setLifetime('thread');</div>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>This extensibility is key for adapting the container to non-standard environments like
                            long-running workers or asynchronous event loops.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Methods</h2>

                <div class="card" id="register">
                    <h3>register</h3>
                    <p>Register a new lifecycle strategy.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Maps a name (string) to a <em>LifecycleStrategy</em> instance. Overwrites existing
                            registrations with the same name.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>

                <div class="card" id="get">
                    <h3>get</h3>
                    <p>Retrieve a strategy by name.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Throws <em>InvalidArgumentException</em> if the strategy is not found. Use <code>has()</code>
                            to check existence first.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

    </aside>
    <main class="content">
        <section class="hero">
            <h1>ResolutionPipeline</h1>
            <p>Orchestrates the sequence of resolution steps for a service.</p>
            <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/ResolutionPipeline.php</div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Class Overview</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>ResolutionPipeline implements the Pipeline pattern to execute a series of atomic steps that transform a request into a resolved service instance.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>The pipeline is the heart of the container's runtime logic. Instead of a monolithic "resolve" method, the process is broken down into small, single-purpose steps (e.g., check scope, resolve bindings, inject dependencies).</p>
                    <p>This design allows for:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li><strong>Modularity:</strong> Steps can be added, removed, or reordered without changing the core engine.</li>
                        <li><strong>Observability:</strong> The pipeline emits events (Start, Success, Fail) for every step, enabling detailed telemetry.</li>
                        <li><strong>Atomicity:</strong> If any step fails, the entire resolution creates a clear exception trail, making debugging easier.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <p>The pipeline passes a <em>KernelContext</em> object through each step. Steps modify this context or use it to look up information.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Story Example</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>Constructing and running a simple pipeline.</p>
                <div class="example">use Avax\Container\Core\Kernel\ResolutionPipeline;
use Avax\Container\Core\Kernel\Contracts\KernelContext;

// 1. Define steps
$steps = [
    new CheckCacheStep(),
    new BuildInstanceStep(),
    new SaveToCacheStep()
];

// 2. Create pipeline
$pipeline = new ResolutionPipeline($steps, $telemetry);

// 3. Run pipeline
$context = new KernelContext('UserService');
$pipeline->run($context);

$instance = $context->resolvedInstance;</div>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>In this story, we see the pipeline purely as a runner. It doesn't know what "CheckCacheStep" does; it just executes it.</p>
                    <p>If "CheckCacheStep" finds an instance, it might mark the context as resolved. If the pipeline encounters a <em>TerminalKernelStep</em> and the context is resolved, it stops early (short-circuiting). This is how caching makes resolution fast.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Methods</h2>

            <div class="card" id="run">
                <h3>run</h3>
                <p>Execute the pipeline steps in order.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>Iterates through the registered steps. For each step:</p>
                    <ol>
                        <li>Records start time.</li>
                        <li>Emits `StepStarted` event.</li>
                        <li>Executes the step callable.</li>
                        <li>Emits `StepSucceeded` event.</li>
                        <li>Checks if it should stop (if terminal step + resolved).</li>
                    </ol>
                    <p>If an exception occurs, it emits `StepFailed`, wraps the exception with pipeline context (step index, class name), and re-throws it.</p>
                </details>
            </div>

            <div class="card" id="withStep">
                <h3>withStep</h3>
                <p>Return a new pipeline with an appended step.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>The pipeline is immutable. This method returns a new instance with the added step, preserving the existing specific configuration.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

            <div class="nav-section">
                <h3 class="nav-title">Think/Verify</h3>
                <ul class="nav-list">
                    <li><a href="../../Think/Verify/VerifyPrototype.html">VerifyPrototype</a></li>
                </ul>
            </div>
            <div class="nav-section">
                <h3 class="nav-title">Guidelines</h3>
                <ul class="nav-list">
                    <li><a href="../../../master-prompt.html">Master Prompt</a></li>
                </ul>
            </div>
        </nav>
    </aside>
        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ResolutionPipelineBuilder</h1>
                <p>Factory for assembling the standard resolution pipeline.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/ResolutionPipelineBuilder.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>ResolutionPipelineBuilder constructs the default <em>ResolutionPipeline</em> based on the
                        provided configuration options.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Understanding which steps run in what order is critical for debugging. This builder defines
                            the canonical order:</p>
                        <ol>
                            <li><strong>RetrieveFromScope:</strong> Is it already cached?</li>
                            <li><strong>DepthGuard:</strong> Are we too deep in recursion?</li>
                            <li><strong>CircularDependency:</strong> Are we in a loop?</li>
                            <li><strong>GuardPolicy:</strong> Is this resolution allowed?</li>
                            <li><strong>EnsureDefinition:</strong> Does the class/binding exist?</li>
                            <li><strong>AnalyzePrototype:</strong> specific reflection/caching.</li>
                            <li><strong>ResolveInstance:</strong> Create the object.</li>
                            <li><strong>InjectDependencies:</strong> Property/method injection.</li>
                            <li><strong>ApplyExtenders:</strong> Run "on resolve" callbacks.</li>
                            <li><strong>InvokePostConstruct:</strong> Run @PostConstruct methods.</li>
                            <li><strong>StoreLifecycle:</strong> Cache it if it's singleton/scoped.</li>
                        </ol>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Story Example</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Creating a pipeline from config.</p>
                    <div class="example">use Avax\Container\Core\Kernel\ResolutionPipelineBuilder;
                        use Avax\Container\Core\Kernel\KernelConfig;

                        $config = new KernelConfig(
                        strictMode: true,
                        devMode: true
                        );

                        $pipeline = ResolutionPipelineBuilder::defaultFromConfig(
                        $config,
                        $definitionStore
                        );</div>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>The builder handles the complexity of wiring up the specific policy guards, telemetry
                            collectors, and lifecycle registries needed for the steps.</p>
                        <p>If <code>devMode</code> is enabled, it injects an additional
                            <code>CollectDiagnosticsStep</code> to capture performance metrics.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Methods</h2>

                <div class="card" id="defaultFromConfig">
                    <h3>defaultFromConfig</h3>
                    <p>Static factory method to build the standard pipeline.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>This is the main entry point used by the Kernel to initialize itself. It ensures that all
                            essential steps are present and correctly ordered.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>StepTelemetryCollector</h1>
                <p>Aggregates performance and status metrics from pipeline steps.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/StepTelemetryCollector.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>StepTelemetryCollector implements the <em>StepTelemetry</em> contract to record what happens
                        inside the resolution pipeline.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>When the pipeline runs, it fires high-frequency events: Started, Succeeded, Failed. This
                            collector listens to them and builds a structured timeline.</p>
                        <p>This data is critical for:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Performance Profiling:</strong> Identifying which step is slow.</li>
                            <li><strong>Debugging:</strong> Seeing exactly where resolution failed.</li>
                            <li><strong>Optimization:</strong> Understanding how deep the resolution graph goes.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Story Example</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Collecting and viewing metrics.</p>
                    <div class="example">$collector = new StepTelemetryCollector();
                        $pipeline = new ResolutionPipeline($steps, $collector);

                        $pipeline->run($context);

                        // Get raw data
                        $metrics = $collector->getStepMetrics();

                        // Export summary
                        $summary = $collector->asArray();
                        echo "Total duration: " . $summary['summary']['total_duration'];</div>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>The collector organizes metrics by <em>traceId</em> and <em>serviceId</em>, allowing you to
                            trace a specific resolution request even in a busy concurrent environment (though the
                            container is typically synchronous).</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Methods</h2>

                <div class="card" id="getStepMetrics">
                    <h3>getStepMetrics</h3>
                    <p>Retrieve the collected raw metrics.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Returns a nested array structure:
                            <code>[traceId][serviceId][stepClass] => {status, duration, ...}</code>.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>

                <div class="card" id="asArray">
                    <h3>asArray</h3>
                    <p>Get a simplified summary for serialization.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Ideal for dumping to JSON logs or API responses. Includes calculated totals like pipeline
                            duration.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Core/Kernel/Steps/AnalyzePrototypeStep.html ===

    <div class="layout">
                            <aside class="sidebar">

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>AnalyzePrototypeStep</h1>
                <p>Analyzes the service class to build a cached resolution prototype.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/AnalyzePrototypeStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>This step inspects the target class usage (via Reflection) and generates a
                        <em>ServicePrototype</em>.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Resolving dependencies via reflection every time is slow. This step bridges the gap by
                            checking if a prototype exists. If not, it delegates to the <em>ServicePrototypeFactory</em>
                            to analyze the constructor, properties, and methods once.</p>
                        <p>The resulting prototype is stored in the context metadata, allowing subsequent steps
                            (ResolveInstance, InjectDependencies) to work fast without re-analyzing the class.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Mechanism</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>It determines the concrete class from the <em>ServiceDefinition</em> (if present) or falls back
                        to the service ID if it's a class name.</p>
                    <p>It skips analysis for closures or already-instantiated objects.</p>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ApplyExtendersStep</h1>
                <p>Applies registered extenders to modify the resolved instance.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/ApplyExtendersStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Executes "on resolve" callbacks (extenders) that allow for post-creation modification or
                        decoration of services.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Extenders are registered via <code>$container->extend(Service::class, fn(...) => ...)</code>.
                            This step looks them up and runs them in order.</p>
                        <p>Extenders can return a new instance (replacing the original) or null (modifying the original
                            by reference).</p>
                        <p>This step runs <strong>after</strong> dependency injection but <strong>before</strong>
                            lifecycle storage.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Core/Kernel/Steps/CircularDependencyStep.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>CircularDependencyStep</h1>
                <p>Detects and prevents infinite recursion chains.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/CircularDependencyStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Ensures the container doesn't hang indefinitely when Service A depends on Service B which depends
                        on Service A.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It traverses the <em>KernelContext</em> validation chain (parents) to see if the current
                            service ID has appeared before in this specific branch.</p>
                        <p>If a loop is detected, it throws a <em>ResolutionException</em> with the full dependency path
                            (e.g., "A -> B -> A").</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>CollectDiagnosticsStep</h1>
                <p>Gather final metrics and attach them to the resolution context.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/CollectDiagnosticsStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Running only in <code>devMode</code>, this step compiles telemetry data collected during
                        resolution into a readable format.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It queries the <em>StepTelemetryCollector</em> for timings and status codes, then attaches a
                            "diagnostics" metadata block to the context.</p>
                        <p>This allows tools (like a debug bar or inspector) to see exactly how long each step took for
                            a specific service.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>DepthGuardStep</h1>
                <p>Prevents stack overflow by enforcing a maximum resolution depth.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/DepthGuardStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Ensures that the dependency graph is not too deep (default limit: 64).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>While valid dependency graphs can be deep, exceeding 64 levels typically indicates a design
                            flaw or a complex circular reference that the circular dependency detector hasn't caught
                            yet.</p>
                        <p>This "circuit breaker" protects the process from crashing with a segmentation fault or memory
                            exhaustion.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>EnsureDefinitionExistsStep</h1>
                <p>Validates existence of a service definition or auto-creates it.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/EnsureDefinitionExistsStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>This step bridges the gap between explicit bindings and autowiring.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>If a service is actively bound in the <em>DefinitionStore</em>, this step confirms it and
                            attaches the definition to the context.</p>
                        <p>If not bound, it checks if <code>autoDefine</code> is enabled and if the service ID
                            corresponds to a valid class. If so, it creates an ephemeral "Transient" definition to allow
                            autowiring to proceed.</p>
                        <p>In <code>strictMode</code>, it throws an exception if no definition is found and
                            auto-definition checks pass.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>GuardPolicyStep</h1>
                <p>Enforces container security policies before resolution proceeds.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/GuardPolicyStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Acts as a firewall for the container, ensuring only permitted services are resolved.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It delegates to the <em>GuardResolution</em> engine. Common policies include whitelisting
                            namespaces (e.g., only allowing <code>App\*</code>) or banning dangerous classes.</p>
                        <p>If a policy violation is detected, it throws a <em>ContainerException</em> immediately.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>InjectDependenciesStep</h1>
                <p>Performs property and method injection on the resolved instance.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/InjectDependenciesStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Injects dependencies into properties and methods marked with <code>#[Inject]</code>.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It delegates to the <em>InjectDependencies</em> action. This step runs <strong>after</strong>
                            the instance has been constructed (by ResolveInstanceStep) but <strong>before</strong>
                            initialization hooks.</p>
                        <p>It skips injection if the instance is just a literal value (e.g., a string or integer).</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Core/Kernel/Steps/InvokePostConstructStep.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>InvokePostConstructStep</h1>
                <p>Executes initialization hooks on the resolved service.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/InvokePostConstructStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Looks for and calls public initialization methods (e.g., <code>init</code>,
                        <code>postConstruct</code>).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>After the service is constructed and dependencies are injected, the container checks for
                            common lifecycle methods.</p>
                        <p>Supported method names: <code>init</code>, <code>initialize</code>, <code>setup</code>,
                            <code>postConstruct</code>.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ResolveInstanceStep</h1>
                <p>The core construction step where the service instance is created.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/ResolveInstanceStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Delegates the actual object creation to the <em>ResolutionEngine</em> methods (e.g., reflection
                        construction, factory call, or literal return).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>This is where the rubber meets the road. If the service is a concrete class, it is new'd up.
                            If it's a factory closure, it is invoked.</p>
                        <p>Once this step completes, <code>$context->getInstance()</code> returns a non-null object
                            (unless resolution failed).</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>RetrieveFromScopeStep</h1>
                <p>Checks if the service is already resolved and cached.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/RetrieveFromScopeStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>The first step in the pipeline. If the service is a singleton or scoped and already exists, we
                        return it immediately.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>This implements the Flyweight pattern for services. It checks the <em>ScopeManager</em>.</p>
                        <p>If found, it is a <strong>Terminal Step</strong>: the pipeline stops executing further steps
                            because the goal is achieved.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>StoreLifecycleStep</h1>
                <p>Finalizes resolution by caching the instance if required.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Steps/StoreLifecycleStep.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Decides where to store the newly created instance based on its lifecycle definition (Singleton,
                        Scoped, or Transient).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It uses the <em>LifecycleResolver</em> to find the correct strategy, then executes it.</p>
                        <p>If the service is 'singleton', it goes into the global registry. If 'scoped', it goes into
                            the active scope. If 'transient', it is not stored.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Core/Kernel/Strategies/ScopedLifecycleStrategy.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ScopedLifecycleStrategy</h1>
                <p>Strategy for instances shared within a specific active scope.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Strategies/ScopedLifecycleStrategy.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Stores instances in the current active scope via <em>ScopeManager</em>.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>If no scope is active (outside of <code>beginScope()</code>), behavior depends on the
                            implementation (often falling back to global or throwing an error, but here it likely uses
                            the root scope).</p>
                        <p>When the scope ends (<code>endScope()</code>), these instances are discarded.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>SingletonLifecycleStrategy</h1>
                <p>Strategy for globally shared instances (Singleton).</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Strategies/SingletonLifecycleStrategy.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Stores instances in the global cache of the <em>ScopeManager</em>.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Once resolved, a singleton instance is never removed until the container itself is destroyed.
                            It is shared across all scopes.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>TransientLifecycleStrategy</h1>
                <p>Strategy for instances that are never cached.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Core/Kernel/Strategies/TransientLifecycleStrategy.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Implements a "do nothing" storage strategy.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p><code>store()</code> is a no-op, and <code>has()</code> always returns false.</p>
                        <p>This forces the container to create a fresh instance every time the service is requested.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Core/ResolutionEngine.html ===

                </ul>

                </ul>

                </ul>

                </ul>
            </div>

                <ul class="nav-list">
                    <li><a href="../Think/Prototype/Contracts/ServicePrototypeFactoryInterface.html">ServicePrototypeFactoryInterface</a></li>
                </ul>
            </div>

                <h3 class="nav-title">Think/Verify</h3>

                </ul>
            </div>

                <h3 class="nav-title">Guidelines</h3>
                <ul class="nav-list">
                    <li><a href="../../master-prompt.html">Master Prompt</a></li>
                </ul>
            </div>
        </nav>
    </aside>

    <main class="content">
        <header>
            <h1>ResolutionEngine</h1>
            <p>Simplified resolution engine implementation</p>
        </header>

        <section class="overview">
            <h2>Overview</h2>
            <p>The ResolutionEngine is a lightweight wrapper around ResolutionPipeline that provides the
                ResolutionEngineInterface contract while using the simplified pipeline internally. It removes the
                complex context and policy layers while maintaining the same public API as the original
                ResolutionEngine.</p>

            <div class="class-info">
                <div class="info-item">
                    <strong>Namespace:</strong> Avax\Container\Core\Act
                </div>
                <div class="info-item">
                    <strong>Implements:</strong> ResolutionEngineInterface
                </div>
                <div class="info-item">
                    <strong>Final:</strong> Yes
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="quick-start">
            <h2>Quick Start</h2>
            <pre><code class="language-php">use Avax\Container\Core\Act\ResolutionEngine;
use Avax\Container\Define\Store\DefinitionStore;
use Avax\Container\Operate\Scope\ScopeManager;
use Avax\Container\Think\Prototype\DependencyInjectionPrototypeFactory;

$engine = new ResolutionEngine(
    definitions: $definitions,
    scopes: $scopes,
    prototypeFactory: $prototypeFactory
);

// Resolve a service
$instance = $engine->resolve('UserService');</code></pre>
        </section>

        <section class="architecture">
            <h2>Architecture</h2>
            <p>The ResolutionEngine serves as a simplified facade for the ResolutionPipeline:</p>

            <div class="architecture-diagram">
                <div class="component">
                    <h4>Container</h4>
                    <p>Public API</p>
                </div>
                <div class="component">
                    <h4>ResolutionEngine</h4>
                    <p>Interface Contract</p>
                </div>
                <div class="component">
                    <h4>ResolutionPipeline</h4>
                    <p>Core Logic</p>
                </div>
            </div>

            <h3>Design Goals</h3>
            <ul>
                <li><strong>Simplified Interface:</strong> Minimal contract with essential methods</li>
                <li><strong>Direct Delegation:</strong> Pass-through to ResolutionPipeline</li>
                <li><strong>Error Handling:</strong> Consistent exception wrapping</li>
                <li><strong>Backward Compatibility:</strong> Same public API as original</li>
            </ul>
        </section>

        <section class="methods">
            <h2>Methods</h2>

            <div class="method">
                <h3 id="resolve">resolve(string $abstract, array $overrides = []): mixed</h3>
                <p>Resolve a service by its identifier.</p>

                <div class="method-details">
                    <strong>Parameters:</strong>
                    <ul>
                        <li><code>$abstract</code> (string) - The service identifier</li>
                        <li><code>$overrides</code> (array) - Explicit parameter overrides</li>
                    </ul>

                    <strong>Returns:</strong>
                    <ul>
                        <li>mixed - The resolved service instance</li>
                    </ul>

                    <strong>Throws:</strong>
                    <ul>
                        <li>ResolutionException - If resolution fails</li>
                        <li>ServiceNotFoundException - If service cannot be found</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="examples">
            <h2>Examples</h2>

            <h3>Basic Service Resolution</h3>
            <pre><code class="language-php">$userService = $engine->resolve('UserService');</code></pre>

            <h3>Resolution with Parameter Overrides</h3>
            <pre><code class="language-php">$userService = $engine->resolve(
    'UserService',
    ['logger' => $customLogger]
);</code></pre>

            <h3>Error Handling</h3>
            <pre><code class="language-php">try {
    $service = $engine->resolve('NonExistentService');
} catch (ServiceNotFoundException $e) {
    // Handle missing service
    echo "Service not found: " . $e->getMessage();
} catch (ResolutionException $e) {
    // Handle resolution failure
    echo "Resolution failed: " . $e->getMessage();
}</code></pre>
        </section>

        <section class="comparison">
            <h2>Before vs After</h2>

            <h3>Before (Complex Engine)</h3>
            <ul>
                <li>Complex ResolutionContext with depth tracking</li>
                <li>Fixed resolution depth limit</li>
                <li>Multiple resolution strategies</li>
                <li>Context-aware dependency resolution</li>
                <li>Extensive error handling and validation</li>
            </ul>

            <h3>After (Simplified Engine)</h3>
            <ul>
                <li>Simple string-based resolution</li>
                <li>Direct delegation to ResolutionPipeline</li>
                <li>Minimal parameter handling</li>
                <li>Basic error wrapping</li>
                <li>Preserved public API</li>
            </ul>
        </section>

        <section class="integration">
            <h2>Integration</h2>
            <p>The ResolutionEngine integrates seamlessly with the existing container architecture:</p>

            <h3>With Container</h3>
            <pre><code class="language-php">$container = new Container($engine);
$userService = $container->get('UserService');</code></pre>

            <h3>With ResolutionPipeline</h3>
            <pre><code class="language-php">$pipeline = new ResolutionPipeline(/* dependencies */);
$engine = new ResolutionEngine(/* same dependencies */);
// Both use the same underlying resolution logic</code></pre>

            <h3>With Error Handling</h3>
            <pre><code class="language-php">try {
    $instance = $engine->resolve($serviceId);
} catch (ResolutionException $e) {
    // Handle resolution failure
    // Original exception is preserved in $e->getPrevious()
}</code></pre>
        </section>

        <section class="performance">
            <h2>Performance</h2>
            <p>The simplified ResolutionEngine provides excellent performance characteristics:</p>

            <h3>Benefits</h3>
            <ul>
                <li><strong>Reduced Overhead:</strong> Minimal indirection layers</li>
                <li><strong>Direct Delegation:</strong> No complex context management</li>
                <li><strong>Simple Error Handling:</strong> Lightweight exception wrapping</li>
                <li><strong>Memory Efficient:</strong> No unnecessary object creation</li>
            </ul>

            <h3>Trade-offs</h3>
            <ul>
                <li><strong>Less Flexibility:</strong> Simplified parameter handling</li>
                <li><strong>Reduced Features:</strong> No advanced context features</li>
                <li><strong>Basic Validation:</strong> Minimal input validation</li>
            </ul>
        </section>

        <section class="best-practices">
            <h2>Best Practices</h2>
            <ul>
                <li>Use the engine for direct service resolution</li>
                <li>Handle ResolutionException and ServiceNotFoundException appropriately</li>
                <li>Provide meaningful error messages for debugging</li>
                <li>Use parameter overrides for testing and customization</li>
                <li>Monitor resolution performance in production</li>
            </ul>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

            <div class="nav-section">
                <h3 class="nav-title">Think/Prototype</h3>
                <ul class="nav-list">

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ArrayTools</h1>
                <p>Array utility functions for container operations.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Core/Utils/ArrayTools.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Static utility class providing safe array operations for configuration and parameter processing.
                    </p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Key methods:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>mergeRecursive:</strong> Deep merge arrays with proper handling of numeric keys.
                            </li>
                            <li><strong>isAssociative:</strong> Check if array has string keys.</li>
                            <li><strong>getNested / setNested:</strong> Access nested values using dot notation (e.g.,
                                'config.database.host').</li>
                            <li><strong>flatten:</strong> Convert nested array to flat structure with dot notation keys.
                            </li>
                            <li><strong>filterRecursive:</strong> Remove null/empty values from nested arrays.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>Used throughout the container for configuration merging, parameter processing, and data
                            transformation.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>StrTools</h1>
                <p>String manipulation utilities for container operations.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Core/Utils/StrTools.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Static utility class providing string operations for class names, namespaces, and identifiers.
                    </p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Key methods:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>classToId / idToClass:</strong> Convert between class names and service IDs
                                (e.g., 'App\\Services\\User' ↔ 'App.Services.User').</li>
                            <li><strong>toCacheKey:</strong> Sanitize strings for filesystem-safe cache keys.</li>
                            <li><strong>extractNamespace:</strong> Get namespace from fully qualified class name.</li>
                            <li><strong>extractClassName:</strong> Get short class name without namespace.</li>
                            <li><strong>startsWithAny / endsWithAny:</strong> Efficient prefix/suffix matching for
                                whitelisting and validation.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>All methods are pure functions with no side effects, making them safe for concurrent use.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>BindingBuilder</h1>
                <p>Fluent interface for configuring service properties.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Bind/BindingBuilder.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>This class is returned by <code>bind()</code> methods and allows for method chaining to configure
                        the service definition.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It provides methods to set the concrete implementation (<code>to()</code>), add tags
                            (<code>tag()</code>), and define constructor arguments overrides
                            (<code>withArgument()</code>).</p>
                        <p>All operations directly modify the underlying <em>ServiceDefinition</em> in the store.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Define/Bind/ContextBuilder.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ContextBuilder</h1>
                <p>Builder for defining contextual bindings (When-Needs-Give).</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Bind/ContextBuilder.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Allows defining specific implementations for a dependency based on <em>who</em> is asking for it.
                    </p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Usage:
                            <code>$container->when(Controller::class)->needs(Logger::class)->give(FileLogger::class)</code>.
                        </p>
                        <p>This builder captures the 'when' (consumer) and 'needs' (dependency) and registers the 'give'
                            (implementation) into the contextual store.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>Registrar</h1>
                <p>Handles the creation and storage of service definitions.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Bind/Registrar.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>The Registrar is the back-end for the standard binding methods (<code>bind</code>,
                        <code>singleton</code>, <code>scoped</code>).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It creates a new <em>ServiceDefinition</em> with the appropriate lifetime and adds it to the
                            global <em>DefinitionStore</em>. It then returns a <em>BindingBuilder</em> to allow the user
                            to further customize the definition.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Define/Store/Compiler/CompilerPassInterface.html ===
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" name="viewport">
    <title>CompilerPassInterface</title>
    <link href="../../../../styles.css" rel="stylesheet">
</head>

<body>
    <div class="layout">
                        <aside class="sidebar">
        <div class="brand"><a href="../../../../index.html">Container Docs</a></div>
        <div class="search-container">
            <input type="text" class="search-input" placeholder="Search...">
        </div>
        <nav>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>CompilerPassInterface</h1>
                <p>Interface for container compiler passes.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Store/Compiler/CompilerPassInterface.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Interface Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Defines the contract for compiler passes that optimize or transform the definition store.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Compiler passes run during container build phase to:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Optimize service definitions.</li>
                            <li>Validate configuration.</li>
                            <li>Transform or enhance definitions.</li>
                            <li>Generate cached metadata.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>Each pass receives the <em>DefinitionStore</em> and can modify it before the container is
                            finalized.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Define/Store/DefinitionStore.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>DefinitionStore</h1>
                <p>The central repository for all service definitions and configuration rules.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Store/DefinitionStore.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Acts as the database for the container's build phase.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It stores:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Bindings:</strong> Map of abstract IDs to <em>ServiceDefinition</em> objects.
                            </li>
                            <li><strong>Tags:</strong> Reverse index of tags to service IDs.</li>
                            <li><strong>Contextual Rules:</strong> Specific dependency overrides.</li>
                            <li><strong>Extenders:</strong> "On-resolve" callbacks.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>It also handles complex lookup logic for contextual binding, including inheritance and
                            interface checks, using internal caching for performance.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Define/Store/ServiceDefinition.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ServiceDefinition</h1>
                <p>DTO representing a configured service.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Store/ServiceDefinition.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>A simple data object holding the configuration for a single service.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Contains:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Abstract:</strong> The service ID.</li>
                            <li><strong>Concrete:</strong> The implementation (class name, closure, or instance).</li>
                            <li><strong>Lifetime:</strong> Singleton, Scoped, or Transient.</li>
                            <li><strong>Tags:</strong> List of tags.</li>
                            <li><strong>Arguments:</strong> Constructor overrides.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>It supports state restoration for caching purposes.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ServiceDefinitionEntity</h1>
                <p>Rich Domain Entity representing a persisted service definition.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Store/ServiceDefinitionEntity.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>An immutable Value Object / Entity that encapsulates all metadata about a service (ID, class,
                        tags, environment, complexity, etc.) with validation logic.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Unlike the simpler <em>ServiceDefinition</em> DTO which is used for runtime configuration,
                            this entity is designed for the "Service Registry" context—where services might be defined
                            in a database, analyzed for health, or queried by discovery tools.</p>
                        <p>It includes logic for complexity scoring, logical tag checking, and environment availability.
                        </p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Define/Store/ServiceDiscovery.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ServiceDiscovery</h1>
                <p>Intelligent service analytics and discovery engine.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Define/Store/ServiceDiscovery.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>A high-level query interface for the container's service ecosystem.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It goes beyond simple lookup, offering features like:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Capability Search:</strong> Find services by tags or interfaces (AND/OR logic).
                            </li>
                            <li><strong>Health Analysis:</strong> Detect circular dependencies, orphans, or unused
                                services.</li>
                            <li><strong>Optimization:</strong> Suggest services that should be singletons or need cache
                                warming.</li>
                            <li><strong>Recommendations:</strong> Suggest related services based on usage patterns.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Invoke/Cache/ReflectionCache.html ===

    <main class="content">
        <section class="hero">
            <h1>ReflectionCache</h1>
            <p>Memoizes reflection objects for faster invocation.</p>
            <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Act/Invoke/Cache/ReflectionCache.php</div>
        </section>
        <section class="section">
            <h2>Class Overview</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>ReflectionCache stores reflection objects so repeated invocations avoid expensive reflection
                    work.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>Reflection is slow. Caching means the container can call the same method many times without
                        rebuilding the reflection data.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

    </aside>
    <main class="content">
        <section class="hero">
            <h1>InvocationContext</h1>
            <p>State holder for a single invocation process.</p>
            <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Act/Invoke/Context/InvocationContext.php</div>
        </section>
        <section class="section">
            <h2>Class Overview</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>InvocationContext carries the target callable and any derived reflection data between executor
                    steps.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>Think of it as a package that moves through the executor. Each step can add data so the next one
                        does not repeat work.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>InvocationExecutor</h1>
                <p>Runs a callable with resolved dependencies.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Actions/Invoke/InvocationExecutor.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Handles the reflection, resolution, and execution of any PHP callable (function, method, closure,
                        invokable object).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>This class does the heavy lifting for <code>$container->call()</code>. It normalizes targets
                            (like resolving <code>'Controller@method'</code> into an object), caches reflection data for
                            performance, and uses the <em>DependencyResolver</em> to match arguments.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Mechanism</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <h3>Steps</h3>
                    <ol>
                        <li><strong>Normalization:</strong> Converts <code>String@Method</code> syntax into
                            <code>[Instance, Method]</code>.</li>
                        <li><strong>Reflection:</strong> Analyzes the callable to find parameter types and names. Uses a
                            cache to speed up repeated calls.</li>
                        <li><strong>Resolution:</strong> Delegates to <em>DependencyResolver</em> to find values for
                            each parameter.</li>
                        <li><strong>Invocation:</strong> Calls <code>invokeArgs</code> on the reflection object.</li>
                    </ol>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Invoke/InvokeAction.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>InvokeAction</h1>
                <p>Main service for callable execution.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Actions/Invoke/Core/InvokeAction.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>The public facade for the invocation system.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It acts as a thin wrapper around the <em>InvocationExecutor</em>, ensuring the container is
                            wired up correctly. It simplifies the API for the rest of the kernel.</p>
                        <p>It also initializes the <em>InvocationContext</em> to track the execution request.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Operate/Boot/Application.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>Application</h1>
                <p>The main class that bootstraps and runs the application.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Boot/Application.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Represents the entire application lifecycle. It wraps the <em>Container</em> and acts as the
                        bridge between the HTTP layer and the dependency injection system.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It handles:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Initial binding registration (Service Providers).</li>
                            <li>Route loading and caching.</li>
                            <li>Processing HTTP requests (<code>run()</code>).</li>
                            <li>Graceful termination and scope cleanup.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ApplicationBuilder</h1>
                <p>Fluent DSL for configuring and starting the application.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Boot/ApplicationBuilder.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Provides a clean API to setup routing, middleware, and exception handling before creating the
                        <code>Application</code> instance.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Usage: <code>Application::start(__DIR__)->exposeWeb('routes.php')->build();</code>.</p>
                        <p>It separates the configuration phase from the execution phase, ensuring the application is
                            fully defined before it boots.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Operate/Boot/ContainerBootstrapper.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ContainerBootstrapper</h1>
                <p>Orchestrates the creation and wiring of the Container's internal components.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Boot/ContainerBootstrapper.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>This class is responsible for the "wiring" phase. It takes the configuration and definitions and
                        produces a working <em>Container</em>.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It initializes the internal subsystems:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Think:</strong> Analyzers, Prototype Factory.</li>
                            <li><strong>Actions:</strong> Resolvers, Injectors, Invokers.</li>
                            <li><strong>Operate:</strong> Scope Manager, Metrics, Timeline.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>It then ties them all together into the <em>KernelConfig</em> and creates the
                            <em>ContainerKernel</em>.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Operate/Config/BootstrapProfile.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>BootstrapProfile</h1>
                <p>Aggregates configuration for the entire container ecosystem.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Config/BootstrapProfile.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Combines <em>ContainerConfig</em> with other settings (like Telemetry) into a single profile.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It supports environment-specific overrides and validation logic to ensure the configuration
                            is valid before the container starts.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Operate/Config/ContainerConfig.html ===

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ContainerConfig</h1>
                <p>Immutable configuration object for the container runtime.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Config/ContainerConfig.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Holds settings like cache directories, debug mode, and resolution limits.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It provides static factory methods for common environments (<code>production()</code>,
                            <code>development()</code>, <code>testing()</code>) to ensure consistent configuration
                            across the application.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ScopeManager</h1>
                <p>Fluent wrapper for managing service scopes.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Scope/ScopeManager.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Provides a clean API for scope operations, delegating to <em>ScopeRegistry</em>.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Key methods:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>has/get/set:</strong> Check, retrieve, and store instances.</li>
                            <li><strong>instance:</strong> Alias for set (singleton storage).</li>
                            <li><strong>setScoped:</strong> Store instance in current scope.</li>
                            <li><strong>beginScope/endScope:</strong> Manage scope lifecycle.</li>
                            <li><strong>terminate:</strong> Clear all scopes and instances.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>ScopeRegistry</h1>
                <p>Storage for resolved instances across different scopes.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Scope/ScopeRegistry.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Maintains two storage layers: singletons (global) and scopes (request-level).</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>Storage strategy:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Singletons:</strong> Stored globally, persist across requests.</li>
                            <li><strong>Scopes:</strong> Stack of scope arrays, cleared when scope ends.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>Lookup order: Current scope first, then singletons.</p>
                        <p>Scoped instances are destroyed when <code>endScope()</code> is called.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Operate/ScopeManager.html ===

    <main class="content">
        <section class="hero">
            <h1>ScopeManager</h1>
            <p>Controls scope lifecycle.</p>
            <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Operate/Scope/ScopeManager.php</div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Class Overview</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>ScopeManager owns scope lifecycle operations. It begins and ends
                    scopes and delegates termination to the underlying registry.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>Use scopes when you want a per-request lifetime. The registry
                        manages instance caching for each scope.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Story Example</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>Request scope lifecycle.</p>
                <div class="example">$container->beginScope();

                    $request = $container->get(Request::class);
                    $handler = $container->get(RequestHandler::class);

                    $container->endScope();
                </div>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>Within the scope, scoped services are reused. When the scope ends,
                        those instances are discarded and will be rebuilt on the next scope.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Methods</h2>
            <div class="card" id="beginScope">
                <h3>beginScope</h3>
                <p>Start a new scope.</p>
            </div>
            <div class="card" id="endScope">
                <h3>endScope</h3>
                <p>End the current scope.</p>
            </div>
            <div class="card" id="terminate">
                <h3>terminate</h3>
                <p>Clear all scopes and cached instances.</p>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<html lang="en">

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>TerminateContainer</h1>
                <p>Action to gracefully shutdown the container.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Operate/Shutdown/TerminateContainer.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>Invoked at the end of the application lifecycle to cleanup resources.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It ensures that the active scope is properly terminated (e.g. calling destructors or release
                            callbacks).</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>

        <main class="content">
            <section class="hero">
                <h1>DependencyResolver</h1>
                <p>Resolves method and constructor arguments.</p>
                <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Features/Actions/Resolve/DependencyResolver.php</div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Class Overview</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <p>A utility service used by the <em>Instantiator</em> and <em>InvokeAction</em> to fill in
                        arguments for callables.</p>
                    <details class="more">
                        <summary>More</summary>
                        <p>It iterates over a list of parameter definitions (from reflection or prototypes) and resolves
                            a value for each.</p>
                        <p>It preserves the <em>KernelContext</em> chain. If Service A's constructor needs Service B,
                            this resolver asks the container to "resolve B, but know that A is the parent." This enables
                            circular dependency detection and contextual binding.</p>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section class="section">
                <h2>Logic Flow</h2>
                <div class="card">
                    <h3>Parameter Resolution Order</h3>
                    <ol>
                        <li><strong>Overrides:</strong> If the caller provided a named value, use it.</li>
                        <li><strong>Type Hint:</strong> If the parameter has a class/interface type, resolve it from the
                            container.</li>
                        <li><strong>Default Value:</strong> If defined in the method signature (<code>$a = 1</code>).
                        </li>
                        <li><strong>Null:</strong> If nullable (<code>?Foo $foo</code>).</li>
                        <li><strong>Failure:</strong> If none of the above match, throw <em>ResolutionException</em>.
                        </li>
                    </ol>
                </div>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>
</body>

</html>
=== classes/Resolve/Pipes/AutowirePipe.html ===

    <main class="content">
        <section class="hero">
            <h1>AutowirePipe</h1>
            <p>Builds services automatically using reflection and prototypes.</p>
            <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Act/Resolve/Pipeline/AutowirePipe.php</div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Class Overview</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>AutowirePipe creates a new instance when no binding is found. It inspects constructors, resolves
                    dependencies, and injects them.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>This is the “automatic” part of DI. It reads type hints, builds dependencies, and assembles the
                        object for you.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Methods</h2>
            <div class="card" id="handle">
                <h3>handle</h3>
                <p>Autowires a class when no explicit binding exists.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>If the class cannot be instantiated, this pipe defers to the terminal error handler.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

    <main class="content">
        <section class="hero">
            <h1>BindingPipe</h1>
            <p>Resolves explicit bindings and handles lifetime rules.</p>
            <div class="meta">Foundation/Container/Act/Resolve/Pipeline/BindingPipe.php</div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Class Overview</h2>
            <div class="card">
                <p>BindingPipe checks the definition store for explicit registrations. If a binding exists, it builds
                    the instance and applies lifetime rules.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>This is where explicit configuration wins over autowiring. If you say “bind interface to class,”
                        this pipe enforces that rule.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="section">
            <h2>Methods</h2>
            <div class="card" id="handle">
                <h3>handle</h3>
                <p>Attempts resolution via definitions and manages shared instance caching.</p>
                <details class="more">
                    <summary>More</summary>
                    <p>If a binding is found, the pipe resolves it and may store the instance in the scope manager based
                        on lifetime.</p>
                </details>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>
</div>
</body>
</html>
